RTCCertificate.summary: The RTCCertificate interface of the WebRTC API provides an object representing a certificate that an uses to authenticate.

remarks.para: RTCCertificate is a {{Glossary("serializable object")}}, so it can be cloned with or copied between Workers using .

RTCCertificateExpires.summary: The read-only expires property of the interface returns the expiration date of the certificate.

remarks.para:
By default a new certificate is configured with expires set to a value of 2592000000 milliseconds, or 30 days.
The expiration time cannot exceed 31536000000 milliseconds, or 365 days.
It's also useful to note that browsers may further restrict the expiration time of certificates if they choose.

RTCCertificateExpires.value: A timestamp, given as Unix time in milliseconds, containing the expiration date of the certificate.

RTCCertificateGetFingerprints.summary: The getFingerprints() method of the interface is used to get an array of certificate fingerprints.

remarks.para: This can be used in application-level code to get certificate fingerprints, which are hash function of the certificate created using the various algorithms supported by the browser.

RTCCertificateGetFingerprints.returns:
An Array of fingerprint values.
Each fingerprint is represented by an object with the following properties:
